passages.text: FY25 First Take: UNPAT beat led by tax; PBT miss led by WM with no update around the potential sale

PPT for FY25 reported 1) Normalised NPAT of A\\$204.1mn (JPMF of A\\$198.2mn); 2) Total Divisional Operating revenue of A\\$1,373mn (JPMF of A\\$1,372.1mn); 3) Total operating costs of A\\$973mn (JPMF of A\\$961.9mn); 4) Dividend (cps) of 115 (JPMF of 121); 5) Reported NPAT of A\\$58.2mn (JPMF A\\$57.19mn); 6) Perpetual Asset Management PBT of A\\$200.9mn (JPMF of A\\$203.09mn); 7) Corporate Trust PBT of A\\$90.9mn (JPMF of A\\$88.3mn).

JPM key takeaways: PPT reported FY25 UNPAT of \(\) 204.1\mathrm{m}\(which came in slightly ahead of our forecast of\) \ \(198.2\mathrm{mn}\) , led entirely by lower tax. However, UPBT of A\\$279.2mn was a miss on JPMF of A\\$282.5mn. This was driven by inline revenues and a miss on operating expenses offset by tax and lower group costs. Divisionally, Asset Management was a small miss, Corporate Trust and Group were a small beat while Wealth Management was a notable miss on JPMF led by lower revenue margins vs expectations. Within expenses, OPEX came in much higher but was partially offset by lower D&A and share- based expenses.

Strategy Update: PPT reported that the sale progress is tracking well but did not provide any details. We note that gross debt came in slightly lower vs the guided \(\) 740-\ \(750mn range provided earlier with gearing improving slightly to 31\%\) by FY25 end from 32% at 1H25 end but remains above the 30% target range.

- Key positives: (1) Costs to achieve cost-out savings have been revised to \(\sim\) \(\)55mn\(vs prior guidance of\)\\(70 -\)75mn while they report the achieved savings were tracking ahead of target at\)\\(44mn\) achieved by FY25 vs the target of \(\)30mn\(and retain the end target of achieving\)\\(70 -\)80mn by FY27; (2) Debt management appeared prudent with gross debt of \(\)738.5mn\(at FY25 slightly below the revised guided range of\)\\(740 -\)750mn; (3) Corporate Trust was strong with strong contribution from Perpetual Digital which grew at 18% in FY25 vs pcp; (4) Effective tax rate in FY25 was lower at 27% vs 27.5% in FY24 while 1H25 ETR was 29.8% reflecting much lower tax in 2H25.

- Key negatives: (1) Wealth Management revenue margins declined to 74bps in 2H25 vs 76bps in pcp and 77bps in 1H25 (vs JPMF of 76.8bps); (2) Operating costs were higher vs our forecast; (3) Below the line costs remain large, ongoing cash spend under strategic review and sale of wealth management; (4) No update provided on the sale of Wealth Management and possible tax implications on this; (5) Certain strategies particularly in JOHCM which reflects the non-cash impairment charge and TSW continue to drive outflows in the Asset Management - known before today.
PTT.AX,PPT AU Price (27 Aug 25):A\\$22.14 Price Target (Jun- 26):A\\$22.50
Figure 1: PPT actual results vs. forecasts
(ASM except per share)
Source: Company data, J.P. Morgan estimates.
· **Total expense growth** guidance of 2-3% (JPMF FY26 cost growth of 1.7%)
· **Total cost to achieve simplification** reduced to ~$55mn from $70-75mn
· **Reiterate** **$70-80mn** **annualized cost savings** target by FY27.
· Continue to simplify the business and pursue sale of Wealth Management Business
· Strengthen balance sheet
· Retain market leadership in Corporate Trust

Target gross debt balance announced as part of the 1H25 financial results on 27 February 2025. As announced on 2 June 2025, the target was reduced to £740 to £750 million for 30 June 2025.
Source: Company reports.
Figure 8: Below the line costs remain a material drag on Stat NPAT
Source: Company reports.
Perpetual Limited (Overweight; Price Target: A\(22.50)

Investment ThesisPPT has a high sensitivity to market movements due to its higher cost- to- income ratio in the asset management business than many of its peers. Hence, FUM fluctuations can significantly impact operating margins, while interest expense of \(\sim\) 60mn p.a. on corporate debt further dilutes \(\sim\) 36% of the FY26E earnings contribution from the corporate trust and private wealth business. We believe PPT has potential for cost savings within the asset management business, where their cost- to- income ratio of 76.1% in 1H25 (excluding performance fees) was noted to be high by PPT in the 1H25 earnings call. The company has said it is continuing with its Wealth Management sale, which may be helped by strong markets and will allow it to pay down debt. We maintain an OW rating on PPT.

ValuationOur Jun- 26 PT is \(22.50, at a 5\%\) discount to to our SOTP value of A\(23.61, reflecting high earnings sensitivities in a volatile market. The discount reflects downside risks to our forecasts from any increase in outflows amid product rationalisation and execution risks around debt management strategy. Our SOTP values Asset Management at 12x CY26E NPAT, Corporate Trust and Wealth Management at 15x, Group costs, Group income including seed and cash earnings at 10x.

Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in

this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. labels: Investment in growth in CT and WM
Total Expenses before movement in external factors

series.name: Simplify
values: Simplify the Group and drive greater autonomy and accountability
Remove complexity and create a leaner, more efficient structure
Complete internal separation to drive end-to-end business accountability, but with Group oversight
Strengthen the balance sheet in the near term

series.name: Deliver operational excellence
values: Strong client engagement built on quality products and services.
Disciplined cost, performance and capital management
Align each business to appropriate financial targets
Establish disciplined cost and capital management practices
Ensure each business has strong, accountable and aligned management
Deliver clear and true-to-label investment strategies
Retain leadership position in key markets through client retention and service innovation

series.name: Invest for growth
values: Improve performance and measured investment to deliver earnings growth
Cost discipline to ensure revenue growth is supported at an efficient level and there is reinvestment in growth areas
Invest in digital and markets capabilities in Corporate Trust to support long-term growth
Measured investment in new products and capabilities to diversify and grow revenue

labels: Net cash receipts in course of operations
Cash before acquisitions and seed fund investment
External FX impact on cash held
